12/11/2018b.name: Stroller Strides
12/11/2018b.desc: Stroller Strides® is a functional, total-body conditioning workout designed for moms with kids in tow. Each 60-minute workout is comprised of strength training, cardio and core restoration, all while entertaining little ones with songs, activities and fun! Each Stroller Strides instructor is skilled to meet you where you are mentally and physically.

12/11/2018b.desc: Ann Arbor District Library offers Baby Playgroup at various branch libraries with one session each weekday.

12/11/2018b.name: Tummy Times
12/11/2018b.desc: Are you a new or expecting parent? Do you want to get out of the house and meet other parents sharing the same new baby experiences? Come meet other new parents, enjoy a drink from Sweetwaters at Westgate and relax while your child has fun engaging with our special toys for young babies.

12/12/2018t.name: Nature Storytime -  Stories in the Snow: Brrr! It's Cold!
12/12/2018t.desc: Join LSNC on select Wednesday and Sunday mornings for outdoor and nature-based activities that inspire you and your child to explore and appreciate the out-of-doors in Ann Arbor’s very own backyard (Leslie!). Each session will be centered around a specific theme and include a variety of hands-on activities, like live animal encounters, guided hikes, group games, and enticing stories.  Programs will take place indoors and outdoors please dress appropriately. Registration is recommended online at www.lesliesnc.org or call (734) 997-1553.

12/14/2018p.name: Fancy Face Mugs with Daria
12/14/2018p.desc: Join instructor Daria White at Funny Face Mugs and get your hands dirty by creating a fun and functional face mug! Working from a wheel-thrown mug form, the instructor will teach you how to shape, mold and form the clay into your own whimsical creation. This class is meant for students of all ages! Children under 9 years old need to be accompanied by an adult. Registration includes 1 individual, all materials and processing. You will receive your special mugs approximately 2-3 weeks after the workshop.

12/12/2018e.name: Capture the Magic: Matthaei Botanical Gardens
12/12/2018e.desc: Capture the Magic of Matthaei Botanical Gardens as you explore with Wandering Washtenaw. Learn about the variety of magnificent plants, trees, and flowers that live and thrive in the conservatory! The Gardens are open late on Wednesday Evenings so there will be plenty of time to enjoy the lovely mystical environment. All ages are welcome to this fun and educational night!  RSVP and meet in the Gift Shop Lobby.  Paid parking is available.  Free Event.  Matthaei Botanical Gardens appreciates your donations.

12/15/2018e.name: Parents' Night Out - Wild Winter Woods
12/15/2018e.desc: Leslie Science & Nature Center will hold Parents Night Out – Wild Winter Woods. The kids (grades K-6) will have a night filled with crafts, stories, activities, a night hike and animal greetings. There will be a Panera Sandwich Box (PB&J or Turkey) for dinner, a popcorn snack, and lots of fun. Activities will be outside, so dress for the weather.

12/15/2018e.name: The Nutcracker
12/15/2018e.desc: A must-see holiday event for the entire family! Join Clara on her magical journey through the enchanting Land of Snow to the Kingdom of the Sweets. With an impressive cast of Michigan’s talented ballet students, joined by international professional ballet dancers as guest artists, the Nutcracker is a wonderful holiday tradition to be enjoyed by all ages.

12/15/2018e.name: The Nutcracker
12/15/2018e.desc: The Nutcracker: Dance Alliance. Dance Alliance presents their 21st Annual Nutcracker at the Saline High School Saturday, December 15th, 2018 at 7p & Sunday, December 16th at 3:00pm, Ellen Ewing Performing Arts Center, Saline High School, 1300 Campus Pkwy., Saline.
